result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter A Scheuermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
**Two days credit if revoked from Probation**
**Court will consider ending probation after 12 months if defendant is successful on probation and does not have any traffic violations**

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Pur. 973.015, record to be expunged upon successful completion of probation.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With Huber, All Stayed pending further order of the Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hunter A Scheuermann

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary mailed to defendant
Pur. 973.015, record to be expunged upon successful completion of probation.

10:02 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hunter A Scheuermann in court without counsel. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Court has colloquy with defendant regarding the charges. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
90 days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Defendant to pay Court costs including applicable surcharges. 
If defendant is successful on Probation and has no driving citations, court will end Probation after 12 months. 
Court finds if defendant is successful on Probation defendant is eligible for expunction. 
Defendant has 2 days credit.

(Case called at 10:09 AM) Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hunter A Scheuermann in court without counsel. 
Defendant is seeking counsel.

Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.
